title: Rolex chronograph
author: ericatwell_

comments.content:
That’s because it appears to be custom.

Closest commercial typeface is Eurostile (Extended or Extended Semibold should do the trick):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile-next/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile-next/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile-next/")

You’ll have to customize the |4| to match, or pick it up from this typeface:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/rexlia/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/rexlia/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/rexlia/")

Agree twice with Kevin. Most probably exclusive and proprietary of Rolex and definitely very close to ' [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/eurostile) Extended/ [Microgramma](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/microgramma)'. From what I can see, 2 main differences but easily redoable:  
- /1: top-bar-less  
- /4: top with extended flat section  
Some more "Eurostile-Extended-like" clients for customization: [House Gothic 23](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/housegothic23) Extended, [Forza](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/forza/overview), [Myers Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/myers-sans), [From The Stars](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/from-the-stars), Latin counterpart of [Arian](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/arian) (variation on Eurostile Extended), [Bitsumishi](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/cheapprofonts/bitsumishi-pro-v2), **[Miedinger](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/miedinger)** (probably my choice here), [Metro DF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/haroldsfonts.com/portfolio/metro-df), [Geom Graphic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/geom-graphic) (nice too)

Just came across this one, [Manifold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317171451/http:/creativemarket.com/connary/84642-Manifold) by Connary Fagen would also be a good option simply closing /4 (and removing /1 top bar).
Awesome thank you kthomps5 and Ryuk
